message: Join us for a FREE workshop in conjunction with Contractors State License Board for seniors and their families on tools to protect themselves from fraud.  1 and 5 seniors has been a victim of fraud and new scams are developed every day. Join us to learn how to avoid them.

Join Rep. Scott Peters, admissions counselors from each Service Academy, and representatives from college ROTC programs to learn about the application process. If you or your high school student is thinking about a career in our military, representatives from the academies and Rep. Peters' staff will be on site to answer questions.
Wishing everyone a safe and happy new year. We will continue fighting for San Diego’s priorities in 2017.

At a time when Americans’ faith in their government is at a deep low, launching a broadside attack on accountability was the absolute wrong way to start the new Congress. Thankfully, my colleagues came to their senses and revoked this proposal. I will continue to oppose any attempt to weaken ethics standards.

Co-sponsored the “Protect and Grow American Jobs Act" to curb abuse in our visa system and ensure innovators in San Diego and across the country can maintain a competitive workforce and keep jobs here at home. We'll continue to push for a comprehensive fix to our immigration system, but in the meantime, this is a smart step forward.

Voted against the United Nations Security Council resolution, which undermines the fundamental belief that long-term stability will only be achieved through bilateral negotiations between Israel and Palestine. I remain committed to a two-state solution as the only viable option for peace in the region.

The declassified report released yesterday concluded interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election was directed by Vladimir Putin, enabled by Wikileaks, sought to undermine the legitimacy of our electoral process and influence the final results. These actions are without precedent, and should alarm every American. We must come together to defend our democracy and ensure this never happens again.

Introduced the 60 Day Rule Act to require any bill approved by a House committee to be voted on by the entire House of Representatives within 60 days of it passing committee. It shouldn’t be up to just a handful of leaders to decide which bills are worthy of consideration. Any bill that is good enough to get passed by a bipartisan committee deserves to get a vote in the House. It's time to get government working for the people again. #FixCongress

Voted to pass the bipartisan HALOS Act to increase access to capital so startups and ensure entrepreneurs can continue to raise capital through angel investors—the primary source of their capital and guidance—without getting caught up in red tape. By addressing one of the biggest challenges faced by startups, companies in San Diego and across the country can continue to grow their business, create high-quality jobs and drive economic growth.

The checks and balances in our government are how we keep tyranny from walking in the front door. Today, President-elect Trump blocked General Mattis from testifying in front of the United States House Committee on Armed Services and blocked us from doing our job, under the constitution, to be a check on the executive branch. We should hold the administration accountable, allow General Mattis to appear pursuant to his wishes, and until he does, I will not support a waiver.

Happy Korean American Day San Diego. Today, we celebrate Korean American history and culture as well as their contributions to San Diego’s diverse and rich culture, supported by groups like the Korean American Senior Association and the Korean American Bar Association of San Diego. As a member of the Congressional Asian Pacific American Caucus (CAPAC), we're working to ensure the concerns and needs of San Diego's Korean and AAPI communities are heard.

The disastrous, partisan budget offered today would blow a $9 trillion hole in the federal budget and leave millions of hardworking families without health care coverage. As always, I am willing to work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to improve our healthcare system, but I will continue to reject politically motivated attacks like these that do nothing to make us more fiscally sound.

From the streets of Selma and Birmingham to the Lincoln Memorial in Washington D.C., Martin Luther King Jr. demonstrated that the road to progress is long and hard fought, but it is our perseverance and determination that keeps the dream alive. My own commitment to public service was very much inspired by Dr. King’s message of hope, justice, and equality. Now, more than ever, it is important to amplify his teachings.

I greatly respect the office of the Presidency, even if I don't respect the man who will now inhabit it. So I will join Presidents Obama and Clinton, Secretary Clinton, Senator Harris, and hundreds of my colleagues at the inauguration. And then, the next day, I'll join my wife, daughter, and dozens of San Diegans and march to send a clear message to our new President about what we stand for and what we'll fight back against.

Spent part of MLK Weekend at Coronado Island Film Festival's second annual Martin Luther King, Jr. Holiday Tribute. Shared the memory of meeting MLK Sr. at his congregation and how that has influenced my career in public service.

Flooding and heavy rain are expected in parts of San Diego County over the next couple of days. Please follow instructions from posted signage, and from our public safety officers to keep you and them safe. Visit CAL FIRE and 2-1-1 San Diego for more information, updates and resources.
Walked away from today's Inauguration feeling exactly what Democratic Whip Steny Hoyer put into words so eloquently.

In San Diego, the border is an engine that drives our economy and creates high-quality jobs. Welcomed Jerry Sanders from the San Diego Regional Chamber of Commerce to a hearing with the Congressional Border Caucus. Spoke on the importance of investing in pro-growth solutions that keep Americans safe and supporting exports made in America by American workers. #SDinDC

Stood with Pro-Choice Caucus to defend the right of women and families to make their own health care choices. These attacks seek to set a new standard in the insurance market to make it as expensive and burdensome as possible for women and families to obtain the full range of family planning options.

I have long been opposed to President Trump’s plan to spend billions of dollars building a border wall that will do nothing to make us more secure or prosperous. In San Diego, we see the border as an opportunity, not a threat, and we know that a wall isn’t the answer. It’s clear President Trump doesn’t understand our relationship with the border and the harm that his policies would inflict on our communities and our economy.

As we enter this new era, San Diegans should know that I remain committed to solving problems, fixing a broken Washington DC and creating a more prosperous future for all Americans-- guided by principles of loyalty, truth, opportunity for all, strength abroad and respect for all.  Read my op-ed in The San Diego Union-Tribune laying out my commitment to public service under the new administration, as well as where I'll draw the line and fight back against extremist policies.

Wishing San Diego a happy and healthy Lunar New Year filled with good fortune. Our Asian Pacific American community has made significant contributions to San Diego’s rich cultural history and our nation’s success as brave members of our military, business owners, medical professionals and more. As a member of the Congressional Asian Pacific American Caucus, I am proud to represent this community in Congress and will continue to work towards a better future for us all. Happy Year of the Rooster!

President Trump’s order to shut the door on families fleeing violence and oppression betrays our values as Americans. So-called “extreme-vetting” has always been cover for policies based in fear and discrimination, particularly towards Muslims. Our existing vetting process is already advanced, thorough, and often takes years to complete. I fear that these actions will not only diminish our role as a global force for peace, but also undermine our efforts to defeat terrorism abroad.
Congress must do the right thing and unwind the President's disastrous executive order. Read my full statement below.

Today, I stood with hundreds of my colleagues and thousands of Americans to call on President Trump to reverse his Executive Order that suspends refugee admissions and imposes discriminatory travel restrictions. Barring legal travel from Muslim nations does nothing to make us safer and is unbelievably cruel to the students, scientists, and families who are building lives here and contributing to the fabric of our nation. I will continue urging my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to do the right thing and reverse this disastrous policy.

Led my colleagues in an effort to get answers on how President Trump and The White House drafted and evaluated the Executive Order that suspended refugee admissions and restricted the flow of immigrants from Muslim nations. President Trump didn’t just slam the door on families fleeing violence and oppression, he did so without any understanding of how it would work or the damage that it would do. Americans want answers, and we’re going to get them.

Since the election of President Trump, hundreds have asked how I plan to oppose some of his most extreme policies & how they can help. San Diegans should know that in this new era, these are the guideposts they can expect me to follow: Loyalty, Truth, Opportunity, Strength Abroad, Respect & Kindness. As for what you can do, click below for some ideas.

Spoke on the damage a border wall would do to San Diego's economy as part of a conversation led by Congressman Beto O'Rourke. Investments in infrastructure and innovation are a much smarter way to spend taxpayer dollars.

Voted against reversing the Bureau of Land Management's methane emission rule, which reduces methane emissions from oil and natural gas extraction on public lands. Short-lived climate pollutants are the second largest contributor to global warming, and this rule would increase revenues, reduce waste, and curb damage to our health and our climate.

Joined 50 of my colleagues to demand Steve Bannon be removed from the National Security Council-- a position that should be restored to the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and the Director of National Intelligence. Steve Bannon has no formal experience in national security or foreign policy, and therefore no place on this council.

From working with San Diego's veterans community, to being their advocate in DC, I've long-prioritized standing up for our veterans and their families. We owe it to every veteran to ensure they have access to employment, affordable housing, and the healthcare and benefits they earned through their service. Honored to join House Committee on Veterans' Affairs and continue fighting for veterans in San Diego and across the country.

San Diego’s talented workforce and innovative culture have made it an attractive destination to launch startups. Supporting entrepreneurs and innovators as they start new ventures by increasing their access to capital and modernizing the tax code will make San Diego a more competitive place to do business, which is critical to our economic success.

Today's ruling is a reminder that an independent judiciary is a cornerstone of our democracy, rooted in our Constitution, and uninfluenced by badgering and insults from even the President of the United States. No person is above the law.  While the courts took a step forward to block implementation of part of this order, I remain as committed as ever to working with Democrats and Republicans in Congress who know that unconstitutional political rhetoric must be rejected in favor of serious immigration and border policies that promote security and economic growth.

I strongly support and applaud my colleagues for asking the Office of Government Ethics to investigate the possible ethics violations of Kellyanne Conway. Their joint letter shows both Republicans and Democrats expect high ethical standards from public servants. This is the first step in holding The White House and its staffers accountable and the fastest way to get results. Ethics should be nonpartisan and everyone in public service should be held to the same standards.

Helped dedicate BAE Systems’ newest, 900-foot dry dock, which will expand the U.S. Navy’s ability to repair, maintain and modernize their growing fleet and ensure their ships are serviced in San Diego.  The dock’s environmentally friendly features are one of the many ways San Diego is leading the way by investing in infrastructure that supports our national defense and also embraces sustainability.

I issued this statement last night before General Flynn was rightly fired, and it still holds true today. Firing Michael Flynn doesn’t excuse President Trump’s decision to put Flynn in this position of power in the first place, and it must not distract us from the specter of Russian influence over this White House. We need to make sure the President is putting American interests ahead of his own. And to do that, we have to know more about the administration’s relationship with Russia.

The ruble stops here. Michael Flynn deserved to be fired. Now, America deserves to know why he was talking to Russia and who he was representing. The American people deserve answers from President Trump himself. And if he doesn’t give them, then Congress must go get them.

As a Member of Congress, I took an oath to defend our Constitution and democracy. We must demand the same from The White House and President Trump. Proud to support the Protect Our Democracy Act, which would create a bipartisan, independent commission to investigate Russian interference and influence in this year’s election. #DotheOath

Introduced a bill to require Congress to work five days a week, for 39 weeks out of the year because there’s never been a more important time for Congress to be a constitutional check on The White House and the Trump administration. To fully investigate Russian influence over the White House, pursue immigration policies that support our economy, pass a budget that provides for a national defense and monitor the actions of our President, Congress has to show up to work.

Helped designate San Diego as a "Coast Guard City" in recognition of our long-standing relationship with the U.S. Coast Guard and the men and women who honorably serve in its ranks. Thank you Adm. Zukunft, Commandant of the Coast Guard, for this honor.

Shared free tax resources for San Diego families at a workshop on the Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) program. 2-1-1 San Diego is one of many local sites where families with less than $53,000 in income, people with disabilities, seniors, or those with limited English speaking ability can get free assistance with filing their tax returns. Click below for more information and to find a VITA site near you.
Here's a glance at a typical "Day in Recess" in the district.
Now it's even easier to stay updated on how we're working for you. Click below to select specific topics where you would like to hear from us.

The horrible threats and vandalism targeting Jewish communities across the country are un-American. Our country was founded on the basis of freedom of religion and no one should feel threatened because of how they worship. Read more in my interview with San Diego Jewish World.

As our top law enforcement officer, Attorney General Session's lies about his connections to Russia are disqualifying, as they were with General Flynn. In the words of Sessions himself regarding perjury, "No one is above the law," and this raises more questions about conflicts of interest in this administration. He should resign.

Introduced the Employer Participation in Student Loan Assistance Act with Rep. Rodney Davis to encourage more companies to offer repayment assistance programs. Reducing the burden of student loans on graduates will make access to affordable education and the American Dream more attainable for millions of Americans.

The White House has said that this travel ban would be fundamentally the same as the last one that was struck down by the courts, and that is exactly what they delivered. This ban still undermines our fight against terrorism and our security interests abroad. And it still betrays our values as Americans.  President Trump has offered no evidence for imminent threats or alleged shortcomings in our rigorous screening processes that justify this sweeping, discriminatory policy. The reckless rationale behind both of these orders makes it clear that his goal is to keep an extreme campaign promise to ban Muslims, not to make Americans safer.  President Trump needs to stop playing politics with national security.

After surveying the damage of the Tijuana River sewage spill to San Diego's beaches and bays, I'm glad the International Boundaries Water Commission has agreed to carry out a bi-national investigation, which I hope will give us answers. As part of Energy & Commerce Committee Democrats, we'll continue to work with federal agencies to ensure this doesn't happen again.

We should be working together to improve our health care system. This reckless repeal would take away coverage from millions of Americans and raise costs for working families. We can and must do better. Watch me oppose the healthcare repeal bill today with Energy & Commerce Committee Democrats:

Shared the story of Charley, 4, and her mom, Stefani, with House Committee on Energy and Commerce yesterday. Charley has leukemia and receives specialty care from Rady Children's Hospital-San Diego thanks to Covered California. For Charley and her parents, the ACA isn't about the numbers--and it's certainly not about politics. It's about life-saving care and the difference between being denied for a pre-existing condition at just 4 years old. #ACAStories

Sat down with Wolf Blitzer at CNN to discuss the 27 hour health care debate in House Committee on Energy and Commerce. We must do better to improve coverage and care for all Americans than this rushed and reckless bill.
Can't make tonight's Town Hall? Follow along live via Periscope:

The report released by the Congressional Budget Office today shows the Republican health care bill would cause 14 million Americans to lose coverage next year, and 24 million by 2026. These numbers confirm the worst fears I fought in House Committee on Energy and Commerce hearing and show we can and must do better.

Visited Ocean Aero, Unmanned Maritime Solutions and learned how they are exploring sun and wind power as a solution to challenges in ocean observation and data collection. Their innovative design and engineering applies this renewable energy to sailing expeditions, carriers and unmanned ocean vehicles-- accelerating scientific discovery and strengthening defense systems.

President Trump’s first budget proposal shows he knows how to make reckless cuts, but not how to prioritize creating jobs and expanding opportunity. It slashes the National Institutes of Health (NIH), which supports good-paying jobs in San Diego and live saving care. It cuts job-creating infrastructure projects that would rebuild our crumbling roads and bridges. And it undermines the U.S. Department of State, whose strong, smart diplomacy is central to our national security strategy. Congress needs to step in and craft a bipartisan, fiscally responsible budget that doesn’t put more of a burden on working families.

President Trump’s proposed budget eliminates the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's U.S.-Mexico Border Water Infrastructure Grant Program, putting funding for water infrastructure improvements at risk. This includes resources to repair cross border infrastructure, like Tijuana’s sewage system, and prevent major spills like the one last month. San Diego is defined by our relationship with the ocean, and I will work with my colleagues to defend this program.

As we work to rebuild our crumbling infrastructure, Congress must focus on public safety and our drinking water. Introduced the Secure and Resilient Water Systems Act to help communities better protect their drinking water systems from drought, industrial pollution, and potential attacks. The bill directs communities identify potential risks to their drinking water and creates an U.S. Environmental Protection Agency grant program to address those risks through innovative approaches, like water efficiency and water recycling.

Led 94 of my colleagues to demand Speaker Paul Ryan allow the Congressional Budget Office to report on how changes to the Republican health care bill would affect healthcare access and affordability for American families. These changes negotiated in a backroom don’t fix the bill. They make even further cuts to Medicaid and coverage for working families, while speeding up tax cuts for wealthy people. Before scheduling a vote, Congress and the American people deserve answers.
Honored to have Joe Biden stop by our meeting this morning. Inspiring to hear from someone who led the fight for quality, affordable care.

Under the Republican's repeal bill, some veterans would be left with no affordable care options and others would lose help with payments if they go outside the VA for care. Our veterans deserve better than this. We can and must do better than this reckless bill.

Spoke against the disastrous Republican health care repeal bill on the floor of the House. The bill did nothing to improve health care for Americans and made the problems of our existing system worse, not better. Thankfully, Speaker Paul Ryan pulled the vote after lack of support. When Republicans are ready to work with us to improve health care for all, we'll be here.

San Diego high school students are invited to enter the 2017 Congressional Art Competition for a chance to have their artwork displayed in the United States Capitol for one year, along with winners from across the country. For more details, visit our website or call our San Diego office at 858-455-5550.

Women's History Month celebrates leaders like San Diego's Sally Ride, who were trailblazers at a time when fewer opportunities for women were available. Promoting policies and ideas that empower women is how we must honor the lasting legacy of women in American history. I hope you’ll join me in celebrating Women’s History Month.

President Trump’s executive order takes America’s energy economy backwards when we should be seizing the opportunity to move forward  with investments in clean energy. Rolling back the Clean Power Plan will only rob us of renewable energy jobs, cleaner air, cleaner water, and a globally competitive economy. By eliminating the social cost of carbon, President Trump has made it harder for communities to know how carbon emissions could hurt public health and our environment.

Thank you to Anquan Boldin, Malcolm Jenkins, Johnson Bademosi, and Donte Stallworth for stopping by to discuss criminal justice reform. It's great to meet individuals using their platform to advocate for improvements to strengthen communities and ensure every American has an equal opportunity.

Today, we honor César Chávez and the legacy of his courageous leadership in the fight for workers’ rights. Generations of workers in California and states across the country benefited from his fight for safer conditions and more fair wages for migrant farm laborers and their families. We will continue to stand up for America's workers by ensuring they are treated fairly and don’t face discrimination in the workplace.

Kevin from San Diego contacted our office when he had trouble getting his tax return from the IRS. We were able to identify the problem with his tax form and get Kevin his refund in about a week, saving him nearly $6,000. Like my page & visit my website to learn how we can help get you answers from the IRS and other federal agencies.

A new report by the International Boundary & Water Commission on the Tijuana sewage spill found there are dozens of sewage lines along the border at serious risk of failing and causing more spills. President Trump’s proposed budget guts one of the existing programs designed to help repair these pipes, so I sent a letter with Congressman Juan Vargas urging Congress to reject these cuts so we can continue to improve water infrastructure across the border, protect public health, and help prevent future sewage spills.

Spoke to Craig Melvin​ at MSNBC​ about my commitment to solving problems and fixing a broken Washington, D.C. I'll work with anyone who has a good idea that would create a more prosperous future for Americans. But I draw the line with President Trump's extreme cabinet appointments, reckless executive orders, and failed effort to repeal healthcare without even seeking a single Democratic vote.

The attack by Bashar al-Assad against his own people earlier this week was an unconscionable act and the latest in a long line of atrocities he’s committed against the Syrian people. These brutal attacks warranted a serious response, but I am concerned President Trump launched this attack unilaterally, without consulting Congress. I hope to work with the President and Congress to hold Assad accountable for his actions, end the war in Syria, and provide for humane treatment of the refugees from this tragedy and tyranny.

Wishing San Diego a Happy Passover.  Tonight, Jewish families gather around the world to remember the importance of welcoming the stranger and helping those in need. Enjoy the week with family, community, and plenty of matzah. Chag Sameach.

Thank you to everyone who participated in the 2017 Congressional Art Competition. We received 61 submissions from high school artists across San Diego. Our panel of judges will determine a winner this week and that piece will hang in the United States Capitol for one year. Until then, be sure to view them all here and ‘LIKE’ your favorite. The “Fan Favorite,” determined by the most likes, will be announced on Monday, April 17th and hung in our San Diego Office.
On this day of renewal, awakening, and joy, wishing you a blessed and joyous Easter from my family to yours.

Skyped with one of Lincoln High School’s government & economics classes to answer their questions on how we’re working to protect the environment, address homelessness, stand up for women's rights & defend our nation's values—some great questions from the next generation of leaders.

Congratulations to Robin Chu of US Arts Education Center, winner of our 2017 Congressional Art Competition, and artist of "Night Walk for Cancer." Robin's art will hang in the United States Capitol for one year. We look forward to seeing Robin and her artwork in DC.  Xian Ying Yu of Cathedral Catholic High School won our Fan Favorite contest with her piece, "Sleep On It." Our San Diego office is excited to display her artwork.  We announced the winners Monday night at San Diego Watercolor Society's art gallery at Liberty Station, where all the artwork is currently on display. Thank you to all the San Diego high school artists who participated & to our judges for making this year's competition a success.
Hearing from San Diegans on issues that are important to them at tonight's town hall.

Visited UC San Diego School of Medicine to share how we're working in the Energy & Commerce Committee to improve health care markets, support medical education and research funding, and increase funding for the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Listened to their concerns about health insurance markets, global health programs, and using telehealth services to improve veterans' mental health care.

Happy Earth Day San Diego. Today reminds us the importance of keeping our air and water clean. We'll continue fighting to protect San Diego's beautiful beaches and bays, and to slow the rate of climate change.

Visited Renovate America for a roundtable hosted by Cleantech San Diego and shared how we're working with Energy & Commerce Committee Democrats to invest in forward-thinking energy policies, defend smart environmental policies to slow the rate of climate change, and protect funding for the National Institutes of Health (NIH).

Spoke on how we're working with House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs – Democrats to ensure our veterans have quality health care, affordable housing and educational opportunities as they transition to civilian life at UC San Diego's event highlighting veteran entrepreneurs.

In San Diego, we see the border as an opportunity, not a threat. Building a wall that will cost us billions and threaten the economic vitality of our region is counterproductive and an insult to Mexico—our friends and best trading partner. It’s clear President Trump still doesn’t understand the harm this wall would do. Read more in POLITICO.

Withdrawing from NAFTA would be a huge blow to San Diego’s economy and the 120,000 San Diegans whose jobs depend on trade. Canada and Mexico are the top two destinations for our exports and being a center for international trade makes San Diego a more attractive place to start a business and manufacture products. President Trump should not cede America’s leadership and instead, work with Congress to renegotiate NAFTA to create more jobs for American workers.

Hosting a forum on the “Future of Genomics” with Congressman Eric Swalwell, featuring panelists from J. Craig Venter Institute, Illumina, Inc. and UC San Diego. San Diego is at the forefront of genomic research and leading the way in precision medicine, and cures for cancer and other genetic diseases. It's time regulations out of D.C.keep pace.  Watch live ↓

Trump made a lot of promises for the first 100 days of his presidency, but so far we’ve seen too many reckless policies that will hurt our economy, environment, national security, and values as a nation. Instead of cutting taxes for the wealthiest Americans, we should be working together on fiscally responsible tax reform to give working families a break, grow our economy, repair our infrastructure, and keep America’s military the strongest and best in the world. We’ll continue fighting for policies important to San Diego and against short-minded proposals that take us backwards.

Heartbroken to hear of the senseless violence in University City. I extend my deepest condolences to the family of the victim and pray for a full recovery of those injured. This is a tragic reminder that even a city as prosperous and peaceful as San Diego is not immune to senseless acts of violence. However, the true spirit of San Diego is reflected not in this attack, but in the brave police officers and first responders, who swiftly responded to keep others from harm; and the friends and neighbors, who came to each other’s aid. That is the San Diego that I know and love.

During Small Business Week, we celebrate the critical contributions of America’s entrepreneurs and small business owners. At the heart of America is the idea that you can start your own business and build it to be successful. In San Diego, we know a commitment to supporting entrepreneurs and startups is essential to economic progress and creating jobs. Small businesses are at the heart of this innovation, so we’ve put forward a plan to help them succeed. Read more & share your thoughts here:

The latest healthcare bill doesn't still protect Americans with pre-existing conditions. It would still cause millions of Americans to lose their insurance, but we don't know how many because we don't still have a Congressional Budget Office analysis. But we do know it still guts Medicaid funding. That's why it is opposed by seniors, patients, doctors, nurses, and me. It's time to abandon this one-sided approach, come together and fix our healthcare system.

Every Purple Heart medal is earned and the veterans awarded this honor made some of the most tremendous sacrifices for our country. Unfortunately, not all Purple Heart veterans can access the full GI Bill benefits they earned through their service. Our bill to extend these benefits to all Purple Heart veterans passed the Veterans Affairs Committee and now we’re urging House leadership to bring it to a vote, and fulfill our promise to our nation’s heroes. Read our op-ed with U.S. Senator Mike Rounds in CNN:
Speaking on the House floor against #AHCA. Watch live:
Voted against #AHCA and against ripping health care away from millions of Americans. I'll keep fighting to stop this terrible bill from becoming law. This isn't over.

Shared my plan to help small businesses succeed at North San Diego SBDC's event highlighting how small businesses can work with all levels of government. In San Diego, we know a commitment to supporting entrepreneurs and startups is essential to economic progress and creating jobs. And in Congress, by helping small businesses access capital and talent, compete on a level playing field, and navigate burdensome regulations, we can help them thrive.

The Paris Agreement was a historic and important step in the fight to slow the rate of climate change. If President Trump pulls the U.S. out, we will lose our leadership role, and his words on clean air and clean water will be just another broken promise. In San Diego, we know we don’t have to choose between a clean environment and prosperous economy—with the third largest clean technology sector in the country, our commitment to clean energy spurs innovation and creates jobs in the process. To keep America in the driver’s seat, we need to honor the Paris Agreement.

Thank you to San Diego’s teachers for inspiring the next generation and helping students reach their full potential. On #NationalTeacherDay, I hope you will thank a teacher that inspired you or share a story in the comments below.

The firing of Director Comey from the FBI – Federal Bureau of Investigation warrants an independent commission and special prosecutor to investigate Russian interference in our election and possible ties to The White House. Congress--Republicans and Democrats--must stand up together in defense of our institutions. Republican Members of Congress who fail to stand against this are complicit in this assault on our democracy.

On May 10, 1950, Congress established the National Science Foundation (NSF) to champion scientific progress, promote national health and support education and research endeavors. Today, NSF supports San Diego innovation from our smart cities project to programs at UC San Diego, ensuring we remain a leader in science and the second largest life sciences cluster in America. Their investment is critical to fostering American talent so we stay globally competitive and don’t fall behind.

May is Jewish American Heritage Month, which celebrates the achievements and contributions of Jews to our nation’s history, arts, government, military, and more. In San Diego, our Jewish community grew out of the first pioneers in the 1850s, who settled in Point Loma. Today, they are one of the most successful and philanthropic groups in our community. It’s an honor to represent a region with such a proud Jewish presence that is growing every day.

Port of San Diego is kicking off Maritime Month this weekend with events at Broadway and Navy Piers. As our connection to the global economy, the Port generates $3.7 billion in economic activity each year, and creates nearly 13,000 jobs. It’s one of the many parts of our maritime industry that supports the trade, innovation, tourism and naval operations that fuel our growing economy.
Happy Mother’s Day to my mom, the mom of my kids and all moms -- the hardest and most important job there is!

Divulging classified information to Russia is a grave mistake by President Trump that weakens American security and puts our servicemembers, intelligence officers, and strongest alliances at risk. It’s beyond time for Republicans to put country before party and hold the President accountable. This crosses every line and calls for all Members of Congress—Republicans and Democrats—to stand together as patriots and demand answers from the President. Anything less is a failure of Congress to do our job and be a check on the power of the President.

Yesterday, I called on Republicans to put country first and work with us to get answers on the ties between President Trump and Russia. Today, I’m renewing that call after reports that President Trump urged former FBI Director Comey to halt the investigation into him and his associates. The need for a bipartisan defense of our democracy and our institutions is growing more urgent every day. It’s time to establish an independent commission to investigate ties between President Trump and Russia and determine whether he obstructed justice.

Join us this Saturday for an open house to learn about this new cemetery and the burial options available to veterans, servicemembers, and eligible family members. Find details, below, on our events tab, or our website.

Now is the time for courage. Now is the time to put aside partisan politics, uphold our role as a constitutional check on the President, and get the answers that all of us, as Americans, deserve. I’m calling on every Republican Member in the House to back an independent investigation into Russia’s attempts to influence our election and The White House. Recent events and revelations have made it clear we need impartiality as we struggle to unearth the facts around this assault on our democracy and institutions.

In San Diego, we know innovative ideas fuel economic growth and some of the best ideas originate in our world-class universities. Our bill would help us better understand how the most successful incubators at universities turn ideas into marketable products by comparing best practices and outcomes. Then, we’ll be able to better support startups, attract talent and resources to universities, and capitalize on federal investment in industries that are creating jobs and expanding economic opportunity.
Thank you to San Diego’s servicemen and women—and their families—for your service and sacrifice on behalf of our great nation. #ArmedForcesDay

We’ll be at Miramar National Cemetery this morning with the Department of Veterans Affairs, and the Miramar Cemetery Support Foundation for an open house. Stop by to learn about this new cemetery and the burial options available to veterans, servicemembers, and eligible family members.

Helped pass a bipartisan bill to modernize the VA appeals process, which will help expedite answers for new appeals, reduce the backlog of claims, and ensure that our veterans receive the attention and benefits they earned in service to our country. The VA estimates more than 368,000 veterans are waiting to have appeals resolved. Our office helps countless San Diego veterans who are having issues getting their appeals reviewed and expedited. I shared the story of one San Diego veteran with my colleagues on the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs – Democrats when we discussed this bill last week, because every name on the backlog is more than a statistic.

Trump’s budget proposal once again shows he is more interested in spending cuts to pay for tax breaks, but not investments to grow our economy and create jobs. The proposed cuts would hurt San Diego’s economy and put a larger burden on working families. Among them are deep cuts to environmental protections, scientific research funding in National Institutes of Health (NIH) and NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration and Research, affordable housing programs, and infrastructure investments – including the elimination of grants to improve sewage infrastructure across the U.S.-Mexico border. Overall, this budget is a bad deal for San Diego and I will work to reject this proposal.

The Congressional Budget Office report on the Republican health care bill revealed roughly 23 million more people would be uninsured over the next decade if this bill becomes law. 340,000 veterans across the country and 183,000 veterans in California would be at risk of losing coverage because of steep cuts to Medicaid. Insurers wouldn’t be required to cover essential health benefits that many veterans rely on, like mental health and substance abuse treatment. Worse, veterans would not qualify for the tax credits in this plan, making it more difficult for them to afford coverage. It’s pretty clear we need to go back to the drawing board.

Introduced the Federal Student Loan Refinancing Act, which lowers interest rates on all federal student loans to 4% and reduces the burden of student loan debt on college graduates and their families.  It’s getting harder for qualified students to afford the higher education they need to compete in a brain-powered economy. This bill would lower monthly payments on student loans, saving borrowers thousands of dollars and reducing the burden of student debt on our economy. By making college more affordable and more accessible for students from every zip code, we can expand opportunities for the next generation.

The Trump administration must make the health risks caused by the Tijuana sewage spill a priority. We need increased accountability, resources for cleanup efforts and infrastructure improvements, and diplomatic leverage to ensure Mexico’s cooperation in all these efforts. President Trump’s budget proposal eliminated resources we rely on to mitigate these spills, but I will continue to pressure the White House and work with the San Diego delegation to get this the attention it deserves. Above all, we must keep our water clean and protect the health of San Diegans.
Wishing everyone a #RamadanMubarak. May this month bring blessings, enlightenment, and strength for helping those who need it most.
Memorial Day honors the brave men and women who gave their lives in defense of our freedom. Theirs is a debt that cannot be repaid and for that, we will never forget their sacrifice.

Joined Fort Rosecrans National Cemetery and Mt. Soledad Veterans Memorial to pay respect to our fallen heroes this Memorial Day weekend. It was an honor to provide keynote remarks a the flag placing ceremony at Rosecrans, and to pay special tribute to Gold Star families who paid the ultimate price to protect our freedoms.

Spoke with MSNBC on why we should honor our commitment to the Paris Climate Agreement. Abandoning our pledge would mean instead of leading in the clean energy revolution, America will be left behind. Honoring the Paris agreement and investing in clean technology is key to ensuring cleaner air, cleaner water, a stronger economy, and the chance at a healthy planet for our children.

One of my missions in public service is to protect and defend our planet by investing in smart policies that reduce air and water pollution, and put America at the center of energy innovation. The President’s shortsighted decision to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement is bad for San Diego’s clean technology sector, bad for our environment, and hurts America’s leadership in the world.

Heartbroken by the attacks in London and across the United Kingdom in recent months. I’ve lived in London among its people, history, and culture. As a country, the U.S. alliance with Britain formalized in 1940, but our kinship dates back centuries. We stood in solidarity with Britain then, and we still do today. Hateful rhetoric against our allies is not who we are as a country, and I hope the British people continue to be resilient and determined, knowing Americans are on their side. We must be vigilant and united in the face of terrorism-- not divided. To the people of Britain, we are with you.

Gun Violence Awareness Day honors the victims and survivors of gun violence—the lives cut short by senseless violence and the lives forever changed by the loss of a friend or loved one. There is a human cost of inaction to prevent gun violence. We see it on the news and in our communities every day. No single action will stop every incident, but if we can save just one life, it’s worth it. So we #WearOrange to send the powerful message that there is more we can and must do.

Spoke with employees at Edwards Lifesciences in California and Utah about how we can support medical innovation and technologies that improve patient outcomes and save lives. In San Diego and across the country, our innovation economy needs robust and reliable support to unlock cures, keep America competitive, and create the jobs of the future. We’ll continue advocating for investments in basic scientific research through the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and defend against cuts that would be detrimental to research and discovery.

Our bill to streamline the permit process for hydropower construction projects passed the Energy and Commerce Committee. The HYPE Act would ensure more hydropower projects are completed and encourage investment in hydropower, a source of carbon-free baseload electricity that can help us reduce pollution and meet our clean energy goals.

Today, the Energy and Commerce Committee passed the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Reauthorization Act, which includes our amendment to support innovation in medical imaging. San Diego’s life science sector is developing life-saving medical devices and drugs, while also creating high-quality jobs. Our amendment clears regulatory hurdles to make this cutting-edge technology available to patients faster, and support San Diego’s growing innovation economy as we continue to lead way in medical innovation.

Introduced the SUPER Act to coordinate existing and effective efforts to reduce super pollutant emissions, which are are some of the most significant drivers of climate change. We have the technology to reduce super pollutant emissions. In San Diego, methane capture technology is partially powering MCAS Miramar. Developing a strategy to implement this technology is our best chance at reducing emissions, making the U.S. a leader in the fight against climate change, and keeping our air and water clean.

One year ago, we lost 49 Americans to a terrorist attack, hate crime, and assault on our values as a nation. Today, we grieve for the victims of this horrific attack, their families, and our LGBT community. Discrimination has no place in a nation as great as ours, and no one should be targeted for who they are or who they love. We also must be vigilant in the face of terrorism and united in the face of hatred. Pride month embodies the spirit of our LGBT community, which continues to demonstrate resiliency, even in the face of adversity. I pray Congress finds the courage to come together and finally take decisive steps to prevent gun violence and keep Americans safe. #OrlandoUnited

Our bill to cut red tape for hydropower construction permits and encourage investment in clean energy PASSED the House. Producing more baseload electricity from hydropower is central to meeting our clean energy goals and reducing harmful emissions that pollute our air and water. The HYPE Act will ensure delayed hydropower projects don't rely on Congress for a permit extension, providing certainty for hydropower projects and the communities where they are built.

The VA accountability bill passed by the House today will ensure veterans in San Diego and across the country receive the benefits and care they earned in service to our country. It gives the VA Secretary authority to fire or discipline negligent employees, and strengthens whistleblower protections to encourage employees to report careless or criminal behavior. Keeping our promises to veterans is not just about resources. It depends on changing the culture at the VA to serve the veteran, not bureaucracy.

In the wake of today's horrific attack, I am praying for my colleague Steve and the staff and others involved in the Alexandria, VA shooting. I hope for their speedy recovery. I also want to thank the brave Capitol Police officers and first responders who saved lives today, and who protect us every day. On days like today, we remember that we are all on the same team and that violence is never the answer.
Wildfire season is arriving early this year. Make sure you and your family are prepared. For tips and resources to prepare your home and make an emergency plan, visit ReadySanDiego and Ready.gov

Not all battle scars are visible, but mental health injuries are treatable, just like other service-related wounds. Unfortunately, the stigma that comes with labeling post-traumatic stress as a disorder is what prevents many servicemembers and veterans from seeking treatment. Our resolution helps remove the negative connotation of the term ‘disorder’ in the hope that more veterans and servicemembers will seek mental health care services. When we lose as many as twenty veterans a day to suicide, reducing the stigma around mental health injuries could save lives.

I'm praying for the families and loved ones of these brave sailors who lost their lives. A tragic reminder of the sacrifice our servicemembers make every day to keep America safe. Rest In Peace and thank you for your service.

America is slipping into another civil war in the Middle East-- this time one that involves Iran and Russia-- with no public debate. Congress is elected to make tough decisions, and that includes crafting a smart, strong national security strategy to keep Americans safe. We owe it to our brave servicemembers and the American taxpayer to debate a new authorization of military force for Syria.

Saddened to learn we lost two San Diegans, sailors Shingo Douglass of Oceanside and Carlos Victor “Hitch” Sibayan of Chula Vista, in the USS Fitzgerald collision. My most heartfelt sympathy goes out to their families. Their service and sacrifice to our country will not be forgotten.

Smaller companies are often the most innovative. In the life sciences industry, a balanced patent system is crucial to incentivizing innovative research and development. Follow along live as we discuss the state of intellectual property and patent reform and what that means for small businesses.

Joined San Diego Regional Economic Development Corporation to announce the first-ever report on San Diego’s world-class genomics industry. San Diego is the center for groundbreaking discoveries in genomics that are saving lives and creating jobs along the way. Our 5.6 billion dollar genomics industry is the most patent-intensive genomics market in the U.S. – a true marker of our innovation economy and strength in developing life-changing technologies. The discoveries of tomorrow and economic opportunities for the next generation depend on continuing to invest in basic scientific research and ensuring innovators have access to capital and the best and brightest scientists in the world. We’ll continue fighting to ensure the next groundbreaking discoveries are made here in America, and San Diego remains at the forefront of innovation and discovery.

More than 5 million Americans are living with Alzheimer’s, which puts a tremendous burden on the family and loved ones of those battling the disease as well as our health care system. On #TheLongestDay, Americans come together in the fight to end Alzheimer's. In March, we spoke about the importance of robust funding for the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to support Alzheimer’s research happening here in San Diego and across the country -- our best chance at developing new therapies and ultimately a cure.

Presented Vice Commander of United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM), General Thomas Trask, with our resolution to commemorate the 30th Anniversary of United States Special Operations Command. As co-chair of the Special Operations Forces Caucus, I joined my colleagues to recognize the brave men and women who we rely on to fight terrorism in an era of new and dynamic threats. Our special operators make tremendous sacrifices – standing ready to respond at a moment’s notice and leave their families for often unknown lengths of time. This resolution is another way to honor their bravery and all they do to keep America safe.

A year ago today--during the Democratic sit-in demanding a vote on bipartisan gun safety legislation--I livestreamed from the House floor because I believed you deserved a seat in the room. Congress has moved backward since then in how it approaches both gun safety and transparency. But whether we’re talking about curbing gun violence or fixing healthcare, you still deserve that seat in the room. It’s your House. Read more on HuffPost.

The Senate repeal bill is a tax cut for the wealthiest Americans that the Congressional Budget Office estimates would strip 22 million people of their health coverage. Out of pocket costs for seniors would skyrocket, fewer Americans would have access to plans that cover essential health benefits like maternity care and substance abuse, and working families who could still afford insurance would pay more for less coverage. It is beyond time for us to start over and work with the doctors, nurses, hospitals, and patients who oppose this plan to come up with a bipartisan bill that fixes our healthcare system to make care more affordable and accessible for all Americans.

Spoke to High School Democrats of America about the issues that affect young Americans the most—access to an affordable education and staying engaged with their government.  Thank you to Ana Little-Sana of Rancho Penasquitos for the introduction and for her dedication as Executive Vice Chair of High School Democrats of America and former president of California High School Democrats.

Over the last three months, Congress proposed changes to our health care system that would be devastating for working families, all to pay for tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans. The most recent version of the bill would strip 22 million Americans of coverage and skyrocket out of pocket costs, forcing San Diegans—especially seniors—to pay more for less coverage. As I fight to stop this bill and work towards bipartisan improvements to our health care system, I want to hear from you directly on how changes to our health care system would affect you and your family.

Yesterday, we made progress on interim and permanent storage options for nuclear waste, which can help move spent fuel away from San Onofre and the Pacific Ocean. The bill we passed in the Energy and Commerce Committee would streamline the process for interim storage facilities to intake spent fuel as long-term storage plans are completed. This bipartisan effort will help make it possible to move nuclear waste by prioritizing decommissioned plants like San Onofre. Providing centralized, safe repositories for spent nuclear fuel will bring certainty for San Diego and other communities.

Voted against reckless immigration bills that would undermine San Diego’s successful community policing policies all while doing nothing to fix our broken immigration system. Instead, Congress should focus on comprehensive immigration reform to strengthen border security and commerce, help our economy, and keep families together. We need more solutions and less partisan politics.
Happy 4th of July San Diego! Thank you to the brave men and women in San Diego and across the country who continue to defend our freedom every day.

Independence Day reminds us of those who fought to grant us the freedoms we are blessed to have as Americans. To our troops serving in San Diego and throughout the world, thank you for defending our freedom every day. We are eternally grateful for your service and sacrifice to our nation.

Spoke with KPBS about the bill we passed in the Energy and Commerce Committee to streamline the process for interim and permanent storage of nuclear waste, which will now be considered for a vote in the House. The bipartisan bill would allow interim storage facilities to intake spent fuel as long-term storage plans are completed, prioritizing waste from decommissioned plants, like San Onofre. For more on how this will help move spent fuel away from the Pacific Ocean, click below.

The bills introduced by my Republican colleagues over the last few months won’t improve our health care system. Their “repeal and replace” approach would cause millions of Americans to lose health care, premiums to skyrocket, and put a burden on seniors, veterans, working families, and the very ill. I will continue to oppose these harmful measures, but Congress should also be working to fix what’s not working in the Affordable Care Act. My op-ed in the The San Diego Union-Tribune lays out steps we can take to stabilize individual insurance markets and keep insurance affordable and accessible for all Americans.

On Friday, San Diego welcomed home Shingo Alexander Douglass and Victor Ganzon Sibayan, two sailors we tragically lost in the USS Fitzgerald collision. Today, Douglass, a Fallbrook High School graduate and San Diego native will be laid to rest at Miramar National Cemetery.  I hope San Diegans will join me and take a moment out of their day to honor our fallen heroes. Their service and sacrifice to our country will not be forgotten.

Visited the U.S.-Mexico border at the Galvez Tunnel to see how security and infrastructure investments can help combat drug trafficking and keep us safer. Also heard from Chief Patrol Agent Richard Barlow of U.S. Customs and Border Protection on how we can use innovation to address these challenges

Visited Pure Water San Diego's treatment plant to see how their five step process can produce safe, high-quality drinking water and help reduce our water supply’s vulnerability to drought, climate change and natural disasters. The long term program aims to provide one third of San Diego’s water from sustainable, local sources through Miramar Reservoir by 2035.

Explored the new exhibit, “Heroines in Arms: Women of the American Military” at the Women's Museum of California—one of the few museums that focus on women’s history in the U.S. and the only one in California. This new exhibit is a fitting tribute to women who served in the Army, Navy, Marine Corps, and Air Force and the progress women made in the 21st century from WASP pilots in World War II to women in combat roles today.

It’s beyond time for Congress to put politics aside and work together on bipartisan solutions that protect what is working in our health care system and fix what isn’t. I unveiled a five-part plan with a group of my colleagues to stabilize the individual health insurance marketplace and slow the rise of premiums. The plan, Solutions Over Politics, would help increase choice for Americans who use the exchanges while protecting plans for people with pre-existing conditions, keeping costs down for lower income Americans, promoting enrollment, and ensuring everyone pays their fair share.

Today, the House debated the defense spending bill, the DOD’s roadmap for the next fiscal year. I helped defeat amendments to the bill that would have prevented the Pentagon from diversifying their energy supply and studying the security threats presented by climate change. I’ve concentrated on defense energy since coming to Congress and for years, the most decorated military leaders in our country have been telling us that climate change is a national security threat. Congress cannot afford to make this debate about politics or ideology.

Honored to meet Ambassador Domingos Fezas Vital of Portugal and discuss defense and economic partnerships between our two countries. US/Portugal ties date back all the way to the Revolutionary War when George Washington opened formal diplomatic relations in 1791. As I told Ambassador Vital: when I’m in a bar in Point Loma, I always say that Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo was from Portugal.

Happy Pride San Diego! This weekend is about celebrating LGBT victories and milestones, but I will continue fighting to ensure LGBT Americans receive the same rights, protections, and respect guaranteed to every American. Have a safe and happy Pride. #SDPride
NA

Helped pass the defense policy bill today, which includes a pay raise for servicemembers, a boost for the U.S. Navy’s shipbuilding and aircraft construction, and victories for defense energy security. Providing for a smart, robust national defense that keeps Americans safe and gives our military the tools to defeat our enemies abroad is the most important thing we do in Congress. We finally passed a defense authorization bill that gives the military the freedom to pursue its energy security goals and prepare for the threat of climate change. Overall, San Diego’s servicemembers, military leaders, and bases will have more resources, expanding the military’s investment in San Diego that supports job creation and drives one-fifth of our region’s economy.

Joined my colleagues on the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs to discuss the #ForeverGIBill with reporters and media outlets. The bill expands and extends G.I. education benefits to cover gaps created by the changing job market, including our bill to ensure Purple Heart veterans can access their full education benefits. The sweeping, bipartisan agreement would give new enlistees more flexibility to attend school later and boost tuition and housing aid for National Guard and Reserve members, and veterans majoring in STEM fields. Looking forward to debating this bill with my colleagues more this week.

In an interview with ABC News, Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price admitted what’s been clear from the beginning: the Republican repeal bill would take us back to a time where an unexpected illness could bankrupt hardworking American families. Insurance companies can’t just “dust off how they did business before Obamacare.” We can’t go backward. It’s time for Republicans to work with Democrats on real solutions to protect what is working in our health care system and fix what isn’t.

The failure of Republicans’ effort to replace the Affordable Care Act is good news for the millions of Americans who would have lost coverage, but Americans don’t send leaders to D.C. to fail, they send us here to work together on solutions. It’s time for Democrats and Republicans to get serious about bipartisan health care solutions. The plan I introduced with my colleagues—Solutions Over Politics—would stabilize insurance markets and slow the rise of premiums. It’s a starting point for an open, bipartisan process to protect what’s working in our health care system and fix what isn’t.

Today, I joined my colleagues on the Veterans Affairs Committee to pass the bipartisan #ForeverGIBill, the first update to veterans education benefits in nearly a decade that includes my bill to give full education benefits to all Purple Heart recipients, regardless of how long they served active-duty. This will help thousands of wounded combat veterans pursue a college degree or job training. At our time of greatest need, Purple Heart heroes fought and bled for us. They have unquestionably earned these benefits, and now they are one step closer to getting them.

Pure Water San Diego just received a $492 million investment from the EPA that can help implement phase one of the water recycling program and enhance San Diego’s long-term water security. I’ve supported Pure Water from advocating for its approval on City Council to funding the Water Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act in Congress. I got to see this progress when I visited Pure Water’s treatment plant earlier this month, and I’ll continue working to see the full program implemented.
Sat down with KUSI News to recap the last few weeks in Congress from passing the #ForeverGIBill to putting forward bipartisan health care solutions.

Our bill to make all Purple Heart recipients eligible for full education benefits, regardless of their length of service, just passed the House as part of the bipartisan #ForeverGIBill expansion. These heroes, who fought and bled for us, unquestionably earned these benefits and now they are closer to getting them. The Forever G.I. Bill also ends the 15 year limit on using G.I. Bill education benefits and will give San Diego veterans flexibility to use their benefits when they need them. It was an honor to work on this landmark, bipartisan effort to keep our promise to our nation’s heroes and I look forward to seeing this bill signed into law.

Led 86 of my Democratic colleagues and sent a letter to Speaker Ryan asking him to work with us on bipartisan health care solutions that keep premiums down and stabilize the individual market. While Republicans argue about repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act, American families face rising health care costs. Democrats have reached out to Republicans for months to talk about real solutions.  It’s time for Speaker Ryan to abandon his one-party approach so we can work together and make health care more affordable and available for hardworking American families.

Joined Veterans Village of San Diego (VVSD) for the 30th annual Stand Down to help address veterans homelessness and serve those who served us. Thank you to Phil Landis for your decades of service and work on behalf of San Diego veterans. It’s been a honor to watch this program idea grow into the successful event it is today.

Filed an amendment to the defense spending bill to block Trump’s transgender troop ban. Brave and qualified Americans who wish to serve in our all-volunteer Armed Forces should be allowed to serve. Our military defends our freedom and ideals as a country and banning men and women who love their country from serving does not represent who we are as Americans and hurts our national security. Congress must stand up to backward and hateful policies, like we did with “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell.” As part of the Congressional LGBT Equality Caucus, I’ll continue fighting for respect for all.

Joined my colleagues on Energy and Commerce to pass updates to the Safe Drinking Water Act, including my bill to help communities protect their drinking water systems from threats like drought, industrial pollution and cyberattacks. Local communities like San Diego will assess potential threats to their drinking water and receive the guidance and resources they need to implement innovative solutions before disaster strikes. These updates will also allocate more robust funding for drinking water safety, increase the use of smart technology, and allow localities to use federal funds to replace aging pipes.

It’s time for Congress to work together on bipartisan solutions to stabilize insurance markets, keep Americans covered, and slow the rise of premiums. Even on an issue as contentious as health care, in an atmosphere as partisan as D.C., we can find common ground. I’ve worked with my colleagues and experts to put forward solutions. We all acknowledge that there are parts of the Affordable Care Act that need to be fixed and parts that need to be protected, so let’s put party politics aside and get to work.

Voted no on a partisan spending bill that could lead to across-the-board defense cuts, eliminates an energy research program that has funded millions of dollars for innovation at UC San Diego, and spends $1.6 billion on a border wall, including $251 million on fencing in San Diego County. These priorities are backwards. And because Congress hasn’t passed a budget that raises spending limits for the DOD, this bill could actually lead to across the board cuts on our military as they fight for us. Congress needs to do its job, pass a budget, and make the investments in readiness and technology our military needs.

Brought a new member of the House Armed Services Committee to San Diego to show him the military assets and operations that make us a strategic partner in America’s national security strategy. From MCAS Miramar to SPAWAR, San Diego is focusing on innovation, technology, readiness and training to prepare for the 21st century threats we face.

Unveiled bipartisan solutions to stabilize the individual health insurance markets and slow the rise of premiums and deductibles. I’ve been working to bring leaders from both sides together since the beginning of the health care debate. Today, I joined the Congressional Problem Solvers Caucus to announce the first bipartisan solution since Senate Republicans’ failed attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act. It’s time to put party politics aside and get to work on real health care reforms.

Celebrated the commissioning of the USS Peralta, a new destroyer honoring San Diegan and military hero Sgt. Rafael Peralta, who gave his life to protect his fellow Marines in the Battle of Fallujah 13 years ago. Like her namesake, the USS Peralta is ready for combat and will join the USS Vinson, the USS Roosevelt, and other strategic assets stationed in San Diego. She will carry the lesson Sgt. Peralta taught us: courage to the end. San Diego is a proud military town strengthened by heroes like Sgt. Peralta and the more than 300 sailors who with embark with the USS Peralta to patrol the seas in defense of our freedoms.

I voted against funding this wall, and I oppose this decision. The Trump Administration is trying to drown out opposition from Democrats, Republicans, business owners, and immigration advocates in San Diego who know another layer of fencing in our county is unnecessary and would hurt our community. Our time and money would be better spent upgrading our border crossings to make them safer and more efficient and reforming our broken immigration system. I will continue working with leaders in San Diego and Washington to stop this.

Last week, President Trump announced he will ban transgender men and women from serving in our military. I filed an amendment to block this discriminatory ban because I believe no brave, qualified American who wants to serve in our all-volunteer military should be turned away based on their gender identity. The President’s announcement sparked a national conversation and as your representative, I’d like to know where you stand. Click below to share your thoughts and join my email updates.

Great news! Our bill to make all Purple Heart recipients eligible for full education benefits is about to become law as part of the Forever GI Bill. The Forever GI Bill is the first expansion of vets education benefits in a decade, and will help San Diego veterans get the education they need to succeed after their service.

"If passed, the Problem Solvers package would likely drive down premiums and deductibles for Obamacare enrollees, said Larry Levitt, a health policy expert at the Kaiser Family Foundation."  Read more in Vox about the bipartisan health care solutions we are working on:

Purple Heart Day is a chance to reflect on the sacrifices Purple Heart recipients have made in service to our nation. The Purple Heart was first created on this day in 1782 by General George Washington as a symbol of bravery. Since then, an estimated 1.8 million service members have earned the Purple Heart for being wounded or killed in combat. 235 years later, I’m proud the Forever GI Bill that has passed Congress includes my bill to make all Purple Heart recipients eligible for full veterans education benefits.

This is a welcome and important step for Pure Water San Diego. We still need to protect sources of federal funding and develop a permanent solution – priorities that will provide certainty for Pure Water and the San Diego region's long-term water security.

I'm demanding answers about why and how the Trump Administration is exempting their proposed San Diego border wall from environmental protections like the Safe Drinking Water Act and the Clean Air Act.

If true, the report on North Korea developing missile-ready nuclear weapons confirms that it is a threat to not only American security interests and allies, but to the homeland. What we need now is a strong, smart strategy to avert devastating conflict with North Korea, not more Twitter diplomacy. Read my full statement ->

Very proud of this milestone, which includes more than $1.4 million in benefits for San Diego veterans who earned them serving our country, and almost $760k in Social Security and Medicare payments for San Diego seniors who have earned these benefits over a lifetime of hard work. We're here to help cut through red tape and get San Diegans the answers and benefits they have earned.

Girl Scouts just added new badges to recognize achievements in STEM and encourage girls to consider careers in STEM fields. Women make up half of our nation’s workforce, but only a quarter of STEM jobs. Celebrating achievements in science and engineering from an early age can help encourage more girls to consider STEM careers as we continue working to reduce barriers to these fields.

San Diego is a world-renowned hub for scientific research with institutions that are making groundbreaking discoveries everyday so, it’s no surprise our own Scripps Research Institute ranked first in the world for the quality and impact of their science. We just passed a bipartisan spending bill that invests $34.1 billion in basic scientific research through the NIH on top of a game-changing $6.3 billion investment in November. There isn’t a city in America better positioned to benefit from these resources than San Diego.

Shared how the #ForeverGIBill will help veterans in San Diego and across the country pursue an education through expanded eligibility and benefits. It includes my legislation to give Purple Heart veterans the full education benefits they earned though their service. Congress just passed this historic bill to bring veterans education benefits into the 21st century and to give veterans greater flexibility to use their benefits for the educational opportunities they need, when they need them. Now, it’s time for the President to sign the Forever G.I. Bill into law so some of these benefits can go into effect immediately.

President Trump’s remarks following the violence that erupted in Charlottesville don’t reflect who we are as a country. There is only one side: the one of respect, justice, and kindness. The hateful, malicious tone set by Donald Trump—from his campaign, to his presidency, to his tweets—is only dividing us a country. I’m helping introduce a resolution to condemn and censure the President’s inadequate response, but it shouldn’t take an act of Congress or public shaming for President Trump to know he’s on the wrong side.

Visited the American Red Cross Women, Infants, and Children facility in Linda Vista during National Health Center Week and learned how they help new and expectant mothers from breastfeeding support to nutrition guidance. Their programs help ensure women, children and their families stay healthy by providing personal counselors and referrals to other community services. The Linda Vista location serves over 36,000 San Diegans a month and their breastfeeding program is the only one offered in San Diego County. The programs offered by WIC facilities are made possible through the Affordable Care Act and USDA programs.

The #ForeverGIBill just became law, which means veterans in San Diego and across the country will have more flexibility to use the education benefits they earned, when they need them. I’m proud to have helped craft this historic bill and now I want every veteran to know how they could be eligible for expanded educational benefits. Read about the seven major changes in our guide to the Forever GI Bill and I encourage San Diego veterans to contact us to find out what they may now qualify for under this new law.

There's a new phone scam targeting Americans across the country, where fraudsters claiming to be from the IRS demand an immediate, debit tax payment. The IRS doesn’t use email, text or social media to discuss personal tax issues, so don’t give out any personal information over the phone. Click below to learn telltale signs of this scam.

Sat down with KPBS to discuss what we’ve been working on in Congress—from passing the Forever G.I. bill to opposing funding a border wall. Looking ahead, I shared how we need to stay engaged in the wake of the rally in Charlottesville, Virginia and how Congress must work together on bipartisan health care and tax reform.

Saddened by the news of another crash and the loss of sailors aboard the USS John S. McCain. This week is another tragic reminder of the sacrifices our brave service members make every day. These senseless collisions have taken the lives of too many brave sailors. Congress needs to investigate recent crashes so we have a better understanding of what caused these collisions, and we can better equip our sailors to carry out missions safely and prevent future accidents.

We lost too many brave sailors in the tragic and senseless collisions that took place over the last few months. As the Navy gets to the bottom of what happened, Congress must also do its part and launch an investigation. I’m calling for a congressional investigation, so we can provide our service members with the resources they need to carry out their missions safely and effectively.
